storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view and manage scheduling conflicts through an intuitive interface to resolve issues efficiently

testCases.title: Verify conflict list display and filtering
preconditions: User has Scheduler role with appropriate permissions
User is logged into the scheduling system
At least 10 active conflicts exist in the system with varying dates, resources, and severity levels
Conflict database is accessible and populated with test data

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict management interface from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Conflict management interface loads within 3 seconds and displays a list of all active conflicts with columns for date, resource, severity, and status

steps.action: Verify the initial conflict list contains all active conflicts
steps.expectedResult: All active conflicts are displayed in the list with complete information visible for each conflict entry

steps.action: Apply date filter by selecting a specific date range (e.g., last 7 days)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict list updates dynamically to show only conflicts within the selected date range

steps.action: Apply resource filter by selecting a specific resource from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Conflict list further filters to show only conflicts associated with the selected resource while maintaining the date filter

steps.action: Click on the severity column header to sort conflicts by severity
steps.expectedResult: Conflict list is sorted in descending order by severity (High to Low) with visual indication of sort direction

steps.action: Click on the severity column header again to reverse sort order
steps.expectedResult: Conflict list is sorted in ascending order by severity (Low to High) with updated sort direction indicator

steps.action: Clear all applied filters
steps.expectedResult: Conflict list returns to displaying all active conflicts in the original default order

postconditions: User remains on the conflict management interface
All filters are cleared and ready for next use
No data has been modified in the system

testCases.title: Test editing and resolving conflicts
preconditions: User has Scheduler role with edit permissions
User is logged into the scheduling system
User is on the conflict management interface
At least one active conflict exists that can be resolved through schedule editing
Conflict details include editable schedule information

steps.action: Select a specific conflict from the active conflicts list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details panel opens displaying complete information including conflicting resources, time slots, affected schedules, and severity level

steps.action: Review the conflict details to understand the scheduling issue
steps.expectedResult: All relevant conflict information is clearly displayed including the nature of the conflict and affected parties

steps.action: Click the 'Edit Schedule' button within the conflict details panel
steps.expectedResult: Schedule editing interface opens with the conflicting schedule loaded and editable fields enabled

steps.action: Modify the schedule by changing the time slot or resource to resolve the conflict
steps.expectedResult: Changes are accepted in the editing interface with validation confirming the new schedule does not create additional conflicts

steps.action: Click the 'Save Changes' button to commit the schedule modification
steps.expectedResult: System displays a success message confirming changes are saved, and the conflict status updates to 'Resolved'

steps.action: Return to the active conflicts list view
steps.expectedResult: The resolved conflict is no longer present in the active conflicts list

steps.action: Navigate to the resolved conflicts section or history
steps.expectedResult: The recently resolved conflict appears in the resolved list with timestamp, resolution method, and user who resolved it

postconditions: Conflict is marked as resolved in the database
Schedule changes are persisted in the scheduling system
Conflict is removed from active conflicts list
Resolution is logged in the audit trail with user details and timestamp

testCases.title: Ensure real-time conflict status updates
preconditions: User has Scheduler role with appropriate permissions
User is logged into the scheduling system on one browser session
A second user session is available (different browser or incognito mode)
At least one active conflict exists in the system
Real-time update mechanism is enabled and functioning
Both sessions are viewing the conflict management interface

steps.action: In the first session, note the current list of active conflicts and their count
steps.expectedResult: Active conflicts list is displayed with a specific number of conflicts visible

steps.action: In the second session, select and resolve one of the active conflicts by editing the schedule and saving changes
steps.expectedResult: In the second session, the conflict is successfully resolved and removed from the active list

steps.action: In the first session, observe the conflict list without manually refreshing the page
steps.expectedResult: The conflict list automatically updates in real-time, showing the resolved conflict status change or removal from the active list within 3 seconds

steps.action: Manually refresh the conflict list in the first session by clicking the refresh button
steps.expectedResult: The refreshed list confirms the resolved conflict no longer appears in the active conflicts, and the conflict count is reduced by one

steps.action: Click on the 'Resolution History' or 'Audit Trail' link from the conflict management interface
steps.expectedResult: Resolution history page opens displaying a chronological list of resolved conflicts

steps.action: Locate the recently resolved conflict in the resolution history
steps.expectedResult: The conflict appears in the history with accurate details including resolution timestamp, user who resolved it, original conflict details, and resolution method applied

steps.action: Verify the audit trail entry for completeness
steps.expectedResult: Audit trail shows complete information including before and after states, all changes made, and full user attribution

postconditions: Real-time update functionality is confirmed working
Resolution history accurately reflects all resolved conflicts
Audit trail contains complete records of conflict resolution activities
Both user sessions show consistent data

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to provide detailed conflict reports to analyze scheduling issues and improve planning

testCases.title: Validate generation of conflict reports with filters
preconditions: User has Scheduler role with reporting permissions
User is logged into the scheduling system
Conflict reporting module is accessible
Historical conflict data exists spanning multiple date ranges, resources, and severity levels
Database contains at least 50 conflict records for meaningful reporting

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict reporting module from the main menu or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Conflict reporting UI loads successfully displaying report generation options, filter controls, and parameter selection fields

steps.action: Verify all filter options are available and functional
steps.expectedResult: Filter controls for date range, resource, and severity are visible and interactive with appropriate input fields and dropdowns

steps.action: Select a date range filter by choosing start date and end date (e.g., last 30 days)
steps.expectedResult: Date range is accepted and displayed in the filter summary section

steps.action: Select a specific resource from the resource filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected resource is applied to the filter criteria and shown in the active filters display

steps.action: Select a severity level filter (e.g., High severity conflicts only)
steps.expectedResult: Severity filter is applied and visible in the filter summary

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button to create the conflict report
steps.expectedResult: Report generation begins with a loading indicator, and the report is generated and displayed within 5 seconds

steps.action: Review the generated report content for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: Report displays conflict data matching the applied filters including conflict frequency, types, resolution times, and summary statistics with correct data values

steps.action: Verify report includes visual elements such as charts or graphs
steps.expectedResult: Report contains appropriate visualizations (charts, graphs, tables) that accurately represent the conflict data

postconditions: Report is successfully generated and displayed
Filter selections remain active for potential report regeneration
No data has been modified in the system
Report generation is logged in system audit trail

testCases.title: Verify report export functionality
preconditions: User has Scheduler role with reporting and export permissions
User is logged into the scheduling system
User is on the conflict reporting module
A conflict report has been generated and is currently displayed
User's browser allows file downloads
System has PDF and Excel export capabilities enabled

steps.action: Generate a conflict report with specific filters applied (date range, resource, severity)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict report is displayed on screen with complete data including charts, tables, and summary statistics

steps.action: Verify the report content is complete and accurate before export
steps.expectedResult: Report shows all expected data fields, visualizations are rendered correctly, and data matches filter criteria

steps.action: Click the 'Export as PDF' button from the report toolbar
steps.expectedResult: PDF export process initiates with a download progress indicator

steps.action: Wait for PDF file download to complete and open the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF file downloads successfully and opens displaying the conflict report with proper formatting, all data tables, charts, headers, footers, and page numbers intact

steps.action: Verify PDF content matches the on-screen report
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains identical data to the screen report with professional formatting, readable fonts, and properly scaled visualizations

steps.action: Return to the report interface and click the 'Export as Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel export process initiates with a download progress indicator

steps.action: Wait for Excel file download to complete and open the downloaded Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Excel file downloads successfully and opens in spreadsheet application with data organized in appropriate sheets and columns

steps.action: Verify Excel file contains accurate and complete data
steps.expectedResult: Excel file contains all report data in structured format with proper column headers, data types preserved, formulas if applicable, and data matches the original report exactly

steps.action: Check Excel file for data manipulation capabilities
steps.expectedResult: Data in Excel is editable and can be sorted, filtered, and analyzed using standard Excel functions

postconditions: PDF and Excel files are successfully downloaded to user's device
Both exported files contain accurate and complete report data
Original report remains displayed on screen unchanged
Export actions are logged in system audit trail

testCases.title: Test automated report scheduling and delivery
preconditions: User has Scheduler role with report scheduling permissions
User is logged into the scheduling system
User is on the conflict reporting module
Email delivery system is configured and operational
User has a valid email address registered in the system
System time is synchronized and accurate
Automated scheduling service is running

steps.action: Navigate to the 'Schedule Automated Report' section within the conflict reporting module
steps.expectedResult: Report scheduling interface is displayed with options for frequency, filters, format, and delivery settings

steps.action: Configure report parameters by selecting date range filter (e.g., previous week), resource filter, and severity level
steps.expectedResult: Selected parameters are displayed in the scheduling configuration with all filters properly set

steps.action: Set the report frequency to a near-term schedule for testing (e.g., 5 minutes from current time or next available schedule slot)
steps.expectedResult: Schedule time is accepted and displayed in the configuration summary

steps.action: Select report format as PDF for email delivery
steps.expectedResult: PDF format is selected and shown in the delivery settings

steps.action: Enter or confirm the email address for report delivery
steps.expectedResult: Email address is validated and accepted by the system

steps.action: Click 'Save Schedule' or 'Create Scheduled Report' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation message that the automated report schedule has been saved successfully with schedule details shown

steps.action: Verify the scheduled report appears in the list of active scheduled reports
steps.expectedResult: Scheduled report is listed with correct parameters, next run time, and status showing as 'Active'

steps.action: Wait for the scheduled report delivery time to arrive
steps.expectedResult: System processes the scheduled report at the designated time

steps.action: Check the registered email inbox for the scheduled report
steps.expectedResult: Email is received on time (within 2 minutes of scheduled time) with subject line indicating it is an automated conflict report

steps.action: Open the email and verify it contains the report attachment
steps.expectedResult: Email contains PDF attachment with appropriate filename including date/time stamp

steps.action: Download and open the PDF attachment from the email
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully and displays the conflict report with data matching the scheduled parameters

steps.action: Verify report content matches the scheduled filter parameters (date range, resource, severity)
steps.expectedResult: Report data accurately reflects the filters specified during scheduling, with correct date range, resource filtering, and severity levels included

steps.action: Check the scheduled report status in the system
steps.expectedResult: Scheduled report shows last run time, successful delivery status, and next scheduled run time if recurring

postconditions: Automated report schedule is saved and active in the system
Report was successfully generated and delivered via email
Email contains accurate report data matching scheduled parameters
Schedule remains active for future executions if set as recurring
Delivery is logged in system audit trail with timestamp and recipient
